Summary Marie is an experienced executive with a proven success record across multiple disciplines, a change agent skilled at global transformation initiatives while driving bottom line through collaboration and team development. She is a dynamic networker with extensive expertise in organizational analysis and in identifying opportunities for operational excellence.  
 
Marie is currently Finance Transformation Program Executive, IBM Corporate Finance, and is responsible to lead key talent development activities. She is the IBM liaison partnering with Sponsors for Educational Opportunity (SEO) and other diversity groups to acquire and grow talent. She is also leading development and deployment of a broad-based analytics curriculum to drive skills from "novice to master" for the 10,000 global finance employees, given their critical role in support of IBM's broader Data and Analytics strategy.  
 
Marie brings 30+ years of experience to this role. She has held key leadership positions in Learning Services, Values-based Culture & Organizational Change Management, IT Management, and Business Operations as well as with Order-to-Cash and Opportunity-to-Order Process Transformation initiatives. This combined with 15+ years in traditional financial roles, enables her to bring a unique set of skills and broader business perspective to the table when engaging with both her IBM stakeholders and external clients, to drive transformational changes and assess the business impacts across the three dimensions of “people, process and technology”.  
 
Marie is best known for leveraging relationships and collaborating to "get things done" efficiently and effectively!
